CatDescriptText: Clayton Lipscomb, stock clerk, Homewood was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mrs. Lageman's answer reads: "I'm for it. Why go to West Virginia or Ohio?  Why not have it here in the state?"  Answer reads: "I like to bet, therefore I'm in favor of it.  Because of many other illegal things in Pennsylvania, we might as well make this event legal."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Clayton Lipscomb wearing short sleeve square patterned shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
